title: Is the God of the United Kingdom the same God that arose in Ancient Egypt while occupied by the Ancient Israelites? - Quora

response.answer_text: Wouldn’t this better be phrased as “Is the God of modern Christianity the same etc etc.” - though “occupied by” in modern parlance suggests the Israelites had conquered Egypt, which seems a bit off as well. Be THAT as it may, modern Christianity and its symbols in secular society (eg. “God save the Queen” in the UK and “In God We Trust” in the US, etc.) does indeed maintain that the God of the Tanakh (which Christians are pleased to call the “Old” testament) is the same God (the Father) referenced in the later scriptures called “The New Testament.” So the God who manifested to Moses when the Hebrews were in Egypt was the God of Abraham and the God spoken of by Jesus, and the God of the various Creeds in Christian prayer. Why do you ask? Were you wondering if some other Deity slipped into common parlance in the UK?

“Is the God of the United Kingdom the same God that arose in Ancient Egypt while occupied by the Ancient Israelites?” There is a theory that the Israelites adopted the single deity concept from Akhenaten. His rule as Pharaoh lasted less than 14 years, and had no lasting affect on Egypt. How it could have affected the ancient Israelites who occupied Egypt has never been satisfactorily explained, and it is possible Akhenaten could have taken the idea of a single god from the Israelites.
